definition: to defend oneself/self-defense/self-preservation
self/oneself/from/since/naturally/surely
Bulgaria/Bulgarian/abbr. for 保加利亞|保加利亚[Bao3 jia1 li4 ya4]
to defend/to protect/to keep/to guarantee/to ensure/civil administration unit in the baojia 保甲[bao3 jia3] system (old)
take good care of yourself!

sentences.english: Many of his statements appeared to be self-serving;
sentences.chinese: Dhao先生在采访中的许多话看上去是为了自保。

sentences.english: Faced with the Asian financial crisis, the company worked out a preliminary plan and initiated its self-protection scheme.
sentences.chinese: 金融危机，公司拿出了预案，并启动了自保计划。

sentences.english: Google needed to move aggressively to protect itself from patent litigation.
sentences.chinese: 谷歌当时迫切需要采取行动，在专利诉讼中自保。

sentences.english: The Hohenstaufen Division came to its rescue, also in defiance of the Führer's orders.
sentences.chinese: “霍亨斯陶芬”师为了自保，也违抗了元首的命令。

sentences.english: When the difficult time comes, they will try to survive by themselves.
sentences.chinese: 一旦遇到困境，他们会选择自保。

definition: to save one's life/to survive
to save from damage/to preserve/to maintain/to keep in good repair/(Tw) security guard
to escape/to flee/to run for one's life
life/to survive/to save a life/to scrape a living
to face the enemy/to meet an attack
armed enemy of the nation/enemy of the Emperor/fig. championship challenger/contender opposing champion in sporting contest
to get away/to escape (from obligations)/to free oneself/to disengage
to count on/to rely on
to escape unscathed/to get through in one piece
military force
to guard against
to lean on/to rely on
to withdraw
to resist/to hold back/to stop/to ward off/to withstand
to wait helplessly for death (idiom)/to resign oneself to extinction
to confront/to face the enemy
